programme.title: Art Rocks
programme.desc: Meet Lafayette artist Cayla Zeek, who draws inspiration for her paintings from the flora and fauna of Louisiana and her own dreams. Plus, The Body Paint Factory in Reno transforms the human figure into works of creative expression.

programme.title: The Lawrence Welk Show
programme.desc: 'S Wonderful' and 'Three Little Words' are performed and Bobby and Elaine dance 'The Carioca.'

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Nora and Ivy are shopping, when they see Ivy and Alvin walking with an unknown woman, leading them to a misunderstanding.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth is invited to Onslow's birthday lunch. Her first instinct is to refuse, until she hears that Rose's wealthy Greek boyfriend has offered to pick her and Richard up in his limousine.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright attends a customer's funeral, using the occasion to settle the deceased's debt.

programme.title: Upstart Crow
programme.desc: William Shakespeare tries to make a name for himself while balancing work and family.

programme.title: The Indian Doctor
programme.desc: Supplies run low while Trefelin is under quarantine. The source of the outbreak is still unknown, despite Prem's attempts to find it. Meanwhile, Megan and Emlyn work together to form a plan to get more food from the next village.

programme.title: Halifax: Retribution
programme.desc: Jane begins her conversation with the shooter - who identifies himself as 'Daniel' - but his motives are still unclear. Jane detects a growing instability, and she also senses he is planning something worse.

programme.title: Austin City Limits
programme.desc: Delight in the throwback country music of Brandy Clark and Charley Crockett. Nashville-based hit songwriter Clark performs cuts from her highly acclaimed Your Life is a Record. Lone Star native Crockett plays tunes from his album Music City U.S.A.

programme.title: Nova
programme.desc: A documentary series that invites viewers to come along for a scientific adventure.

programme.title: Nature
programme.desc: Follow the struggles, failures and triumphs of a single osprey family. Ospreys are unique among raptors for their ability to hunt live fish and dive into water.

programme.title: Secrets of the Dead
programme.desc: Incredible scientific investigations from across the globe are helping piece together the untold story of prehistoric women. The latest research separates fact from fiction and sheds new light on our ancient foremothers.

programme.title: American Veteran
programme.desc: As recruits take the oath to serve, they leave the civilian world to become a soldier, sailor, marine, airman or woman. This is the start of their transformation.

programme.title: Washington Week
programme.desc: The panel will discuss the challenges the president faces getting agreement within his party on paying for the bipartisan infrastructure bill and whether he can get progressives and moderates on board with plans.

programme.title: Firing Line With Margaret Hoover
programme.desc: Sen. Bob Menendez, D-NJ, discusses his immigration reform plan and protecting Americans against floods. The Senate Foreign Relations Committee chair outlines how the U.S. should promote democracy in Cuba, support Taiwan and prevent a nuclear Iran.

programme.title: To the Contrary
programme.desc: Examines major issues with women of various ethnic and political backgrounds.

programme.title: Louisiana: The State We're In
programme.desc: The LSU Tigers will name the court of the Pete Maravich Assembly Center in honor of the legendary Dale Brown; Lake Charles Mayor Nic Hunter discusses setbacks in hurricane recovery; Louisiana faces a teacher shortage.

programme.title: Arthur and the Haunted Tree House
programme.desc: While trick-or-treating, Francine meets an elderly woman with a very mysterious past, while Binky finds himself at Mr. Ratburn's amazing haunted house. And, Arthur, Buster, and Ladonna's tree house sleepover seems to be haunted!

programme.title: Wild Kratts
programme.desc: The Wild Kratts aren't too sure what to do for Halloween. Martin and Chris don't realize that Zach and the other villains have come up with a plan to ruin Halloween.

programme.title: Curious George: A Halloween Boo Fest
programme.desc: George is excited to spend his first Halloween in the country. When Bill tells George and Allie a spooky tale about a scarecrow that haunts the countryside, the two pals set out to get a photo of the fearsome creature.

programme.title: Nature
programme.desc: Follow the struggles, failures and triumphs of a single osprey family. Ospreys are unique among raptors for their ability to hunt live fish and dive into water.

programme.title: World's Greatest Cemeteries

programme.title: History With David Rubenstein

programme.title: Beyond the Canvas
programme.desc: Meet some of the people recognized at the highest levels in their fields. Conductor Michael Tilson Thomas, filmmaker Sir David Attenborough and others reveal what it takes to achieve excellence.

programme.title: The Art Detectives
programme.desc: Dr. Bendor Grosvenor & Jacky Klein seek out the work of some of the biggest names in art.

programme.title: Outside: Beyond the Lens

programme.title: Frankie Drake Mysteries
programme.desc: After her wartime friend goes missing in London, Frankie must work with Agatha Christie to uncover the reason behind the disappearance.
